page.title: 05ATTITUDES & SOCIAL CONCERN.
page.content: Residents feel that village life is peaceful quiet and private. Although living here could be lonely. An effort to 'get involved' is essential for those needing contact with others There is a good community feeling also a good environment to bring children up in. Due to lack of amenities, housing and limited number of local jobs in the village many young people have to leave the village. A 'focal point' in the village is lacking since the closure of the village shop and post office in l982 Most residents feel a village shop is needed both to help older residents and also to create a centre for providing a meeting place.Plans are underway to restore a shop in l985 Planning permission was at first refused but a petition has been organized to object to this decision.
